lines.text: Never hate your enemies. It affects your judgment.
Just when I thought I was out... they pull me back in.
Never let anyone know what you are thinking.
Friends and money - oil and water.

I, uh, betrayed my wife. I betrayed myself. I've killed men, and I ordered men to be killed. No, it's useless. I killed... I ordered the death of my brother; he injured me. I killed my mother's son. I killed my father's son.
Don Lucchesi, you are a man of finance and politics. These things I don't understand.
You understand guns?
Yes.
Finance is a gun. Politics is knowing when to pull the trigger.
When they come... they come at what you love.

[in the helicopter]
I'd like to take Joey Zasa up in one of these and drop him.
Joey Zasa is nothing. He's a small-time enforcer. He bluffs, threats, but nothing. You can see him coming a mile away.
We should kill him before he kills...
No! Never hate your enemies. It affects your judgment.
Your enemies always get strong on what you leave behind.
I feel... I'm getting wiser now.
The sicker you get, the wiser you get, huh?
When I'm dead, I'm gonna be really smart.
The richest man is the one with the most powerful friends.

[after learning of Zasa's assassination]
Don't ever give an order like that again. Not while I'm alive.
Uncle Mike, it had to be done. You were too sick to make a decision. I got the go ahead from Neri and Connie.
Connie.
It was the right thing to do.
It was not the right thing to do. I command this family, right or wrong. It was not what I wanted! Understand?
Yes.
[Michael looks at Neri]
Yes.
[Michael looks at Connie for a long time]
Yes!
Vincent, help me to my bed. I want to talk to you alone.

[Vincent helps Michael into his bed]
My brother, your father, he and I. Opposites. But I never doubted his love. He would do anything for me. But his temper. Clouded his judgement. I don't want to see the same thing happen to you.
I'll always love you.
Love somebody else.
You had a gun. They only had a knife. You could have talked them into surrendering. Turned them over to the police.
Hey, Uncle Mike, Zasa sent these guys I was just sending him a message that's all.
Now he has to send you a message back.
Joey Zasa's gonna send me a message? Joey Zasa's gonna send me a message?
Michael, he did the right thing. He got Zasa's name.

What's Joey Zasa got to do this this? Joey Zasa's a patso. Joey Zasa. Alright, you are what you are. It's in your nature. From now on you stick close to me. You don't go anywhere, you don't do anything, you don't talk to anyone without checking with me first, understand?
Yeah.
I've got problems with the commission, young man!
Yeah, I know.
You don't make them any easier.
I know.
Alright, go on. Get out of here.
Michael.
Yes.
Now they'll fear you.
Maybe they should fear you.
It's not personal. It's business.
Very well. You want to do business with me. I will do business with you.

[to Mary]
I would burn in hell to keep you safe.
He'd better be careful. It's dangerous to be a honest man.

[about the pope; before the opera]
The Pope's doing exactly what you said he'd do, he's cleaning house.
He should be careful. It's dangerous to be an honest man.
The Miucci association and elected you their Italian American man of the year.
[hands Michael a plaque]
Oh, Miucci. Who's Miucci?
He's the Italian American who invented the telephone. He did it one year before Alexander Graham Bell.
Oh. And this is the reason you have come to my home on this day.
I have a stone in my shoe, Mr. Corleone. A two-bit punk who works for me. Who thinks he's related to you. A bastard.
He's here. Vincent Mancini. He's at the party.
Well, bring him in.
I think it's good that we talk. I have a problem. Now I have to find out if it is my problem or your problem.
Joey, your business is your business. I have no interest, no percentages. I'm out.
Good, then it is my problem.

[Connie and Vincent enter]
Michael, you know Vincent Mancini. Sonny's boy.
Hey, how you doin' Mr. Corleone.
How you doing.
I'm doin' good. How you doin'?
Good.
Nice party.
Oh, you like it?
Yeah, I had to sneak in.
Well, you dressed for it. What's the trouble between you and Mr. Joe Zasa?
Just trouble. I'll take care of it.
That's foolish of you.
Foolish of me? It's a little foolish of this guy don't you think? Right? RIGHT!

Temper like his father. Vincent, Mr. Joe Zasa now owns what used to be the Corleone family business in New York. Out of the kindness of his heart he gave you a job with his family. Contrary to my advice you took the job. I offered you something better. Something in the legitimate world. You turned me down. Now you both come to me with this bad blood. What do you expect me to do? Am I a gangster?
No, no, you're not a gangster, Uncle Mike.
Michael, that's Papa's old neighborhood now it's a sewer. Zasa runs it like a disgrace the ladies told me.
Well you tell him from me, that he can live, or he can die.
Vincent, will you SHUT UP!
I've lost the lust for women, and now my mind is clear.
What's wrong with being a lawyer?
Nothing, except he doesn't want it. He loves music he wants his life to be in music.
Well, music is great. I love music but he should finish what he started. Anthony.
I'm going my own way.
Your own way.
Uh-huh.
Professional singer.
That's right.
And what happens if you fail.
I won't fail.
Men always believe that. With a law degree you're taking on insurance. After that you can do anything you want. You can work for me.
I will never work for you. I have bad memories.
All families have bad memories.
I will always be your son, but I will never have anything to do with your business.
Anthony, finish the law degree.
No.
That he got from you. That "no."
You could have helped me, Kay. You could have helped me to convince him.
Convince him of what?
He throws his life away. He throws greatness away!
This is greatness? You know, Michael, now that you're so respectable I think you're more dangerous than you ever were. In fact, I preferred you when you were just a common Mafia hood.
Alright, can we talk now? Common sense?
Alright. Tony knows you killed Fredo.
Why did you come here?
I came here to protect my son. I didn't come here to see you disguised by your church. I thought that was a shameful ceremony.
I spent my life protecting my son. I spent my life protecting my family!
Let's be reasonable here, Michael. I mean, that's your big thing, isn't it? Reason backed up by murder.
Oh, God, you hate me. You hate me.
No, I don't hate you, Michael. I dread you.
I did what I could, Kay, to protect all of you from the horrors of this world.
But you became my horror. The children still love you, though. Especially Mary.
Well, that's something. We can build on that. For their sake. Let's try.
Only if you let Tony go to live his own life. Away from you.
I'll let Tony go.
Thank you.
I earned that territory with my talent. The commission gave it to me. You approved.
Yes.
Hey, Uncle Mike, I'm just here for the party. I didn't come here to ask for help. I could just kill this bastard. He's the one who should be asking for help.
Then kill him. What does this have to do with me?
Well, he's going around your back saying "fuck Michael Corleone." That's what it has to do with you.

[to Zasa]
Say it to his face one time. ONE TIME!
Mr. Corleone, all bastards are liars Shakespear wrote poems about them.
What am I gonna do with this guy. WHAT!
Joey, if there is someone going around this city saying "fuck Michael Corleone" what do we do with a piece of shit like this? He's a fuckin' dog.
Yes, if someone were to say such a thing they would not be a friend, they would be a dog.
My interests don't conflict with Mr. Joe Zasa's.
Oh yes they do, Uncle Mike. More than you know.
Michael, he needs your support!
Hey, Uncle Mike, don't make me work for this guy no more. I come work for you.

For me? As what? A tough guy? I don't need tough guys. I need more lawyers. Joey, since we have no conflicts no debts I accept your tribute. I wish you well. Vincent, come make your peace with Mr. Joe Zasa.

[Vincent hugs Zasa]
Bastarde.

[Vincent bites Zasa's ear and Zasa's is taken out of the office]
Jesus! Shut it, shut it, shut it.
Hey Uncle Mike this wasn't the time for this. I mean, I know you're into bankers and Wall Street and your word is gold but I just want to protect you from this guy and your lawyers can't do that.
But you can.
Yeah, I can.
And why should I be afraid of Joe Zasa?
Because he knows you're keeping him from moving up in the commission. I say we make him dead. You give the word and I'll take care of it myself.
Maybe you should come with me for a few weeks. See what happens. See how much you learn. Then, we'll talk about your future.
I won't let you down.
Alright, go on.
[Michael is kneeling alone in a room at the corpse of Don Tommasino in a coffin]
Give me a chance to redeem myself, and I will sin, no more.
Nephew, from this moment on, call yourself Vincent Corleone.
[delivering a message from Michael Corleone to Don Lucchesi]
Power wears out those who do not have it.
[stabs him]
The higher I go, the crookeder it becomes.
I am your son. Command me in all things.
Give up my daughter. That is the price you pay for the life you choose.
It seems in today's world the power to absolve debt is greater than the power of forgiveness.
Treachery is everywhere.
You still have your fingers on the strings, even now.
[last lines]

[realizing she has been shot]
Dad?
Italian politics have had these men for centuries. They are the true Mafia.
Bastardo.
I must accept my age, and grow my olives and tomatoes.

[during a meeting in Atlantic City]
I say to all of you, I have been treated this day, with no respect. I've earned you all money. I've made you rich, and I asked for little. Good. You will not give, I'll take! As for Don, Corleone, well he makes it, very clear to me today, that he is my enemy. You must choose between us.

[briefing the reporters]
The Pope - the Holy Father himself - has this very day blessed Michael Corleone; and you think you know better than the Pope?

[regarding Vincent]
This is the hero who put Joey Zasa in his grave. If we'd known of his existence, we would never have backed Joey.
No one wants another Joe.
[during a press conference in the Vatican]
The Pope, is gravely ill. Until he recovers, I am powerless.
What if he dies?
Then, as you Americans say, all bets are off.
We should wet our beaks a little.
[In a church, planning a hit on Joey Zasa]
Look! I'd love to smack Joey Zasa and then whack the bag, Okay? But it's impossible. He's always mingling with people. In front of TV cameras, in his own neighborhood, it's impossible.

[Giving instructions in a voiceover]
Neri; go to Rome. Light a candle for the archbishop.
You know, Michael; now that you're so respectable, I think you're more dangerous than ever. I liked you better when you were just a common Mafia hood.
[first lines]

It is now better than several years since I moved to New York, and I haven't seen you as much as I would like to. I hope you will come to the ceremony of papal honors given for my charitable work. The only wealth in this world is children; more than all the money, power on earth, you are my treasure.
Your sins are terrible. It is just that you suffer. Your life could be redeemed, but I know you don't believe that. You will not change.
[grants Michael the Rite of Absolution]
Kay, I had a very different destiny planned for us.
I swear on the lives of my children, give me one last chance to redeem myself and I will sin no more.

Uncle Michael, listen - I know you're into banks and Wall Street, but everyone knows you're the final word, you're like the Supreme Court. All I want to do is protect you from these guys and your lawyers can't do that.
It's your favorite song, Michael, where you going?
I'm just gonna go into the kitchen and listen to some Tony Bennett records.

[Vincent has caught one of Zaza's hitmen and is talking to the other]
Wait a minute, don't do anything, just watch. I'm going to show you something, just watch, OK?
[shoots the one he is holding]

[killer releases Grace]
All right, just relax. Now, tell me; who sent you?

[still in shock]
Joey, Joey Zaza. He sent us to kill you.
Thanks.
[shoots the second killer]
It never ends.

[delirious]
Altobello, you FUCK! You deceitful old fuck!
Joey Zasa's a pazzo!
If someone is going around this city saying, "Fuck Michael Corleone," what do we do with a piece of shit like that? He's a fuckin' dog.
Yes, it's true. If someone were to say such a thing, they would not be a friend. They would be a dog.
Do you still fear me Kay?
I don't fear you Michael, I just dread you.
Now they'll fear you. Michael.
Maybe they should fear YOU!
Vincent, would you SHADDUP?

[wanting to go on his own being an opera singer instead of a lawyer]
I will always be your son, but I will never have anything to do with your business.
You are my 'ace in the hole,' as we say in America. I have a stone in my shoe. You can remove it.
Only one stone?

[regarding Michael]
It's dangerous. A famous man. You will have to take precautions.
Tell me what to do. Then I will tell you my price.
You like to gamble? Why don't we go to Atlantic City? My town. I'll show you how to gamble.
Yeah, but I like to win. How will I know what numbers to pick?
Do I look okay like a guy who's gonna lose?
